[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure Authentication System (SAS) defines requirements for encrypted login transactions, OS compatibility, and system reliability.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SAS integrates with authentication services, security monitoring, and OS security frameworks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SAS provides a secure, role-based UI for administrators and users.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SAS operates on Windows-based configurations for desktops and enterprise environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SAS uses a React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL database.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SAS ensures encrypted data exchange via TLS 1.3 and SSL.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SAS handles authentication requests and OS security enforcement.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SAS supports deployment across Windows-based systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SAS connects to authentication, logging, and compliance APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: SAS optimizes authentication processing for high request loads.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SAS ensures authentication, OS compliance, secure login processing, and security monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SAS is designed for enterprise users, administrators, and security personnel managing secure access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SAS requires network access for authentication and OS security enforcement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SAS relies on encryption, Windows security policies, and compliance tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 MISSING-TAG1: SAS ensures secure authentication, encrypted transactions, OS security compliance, and access control enforcement.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication and security monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure compliance with OS-level security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enforce secure login using unique user credentials (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall encrypt authentication transactions between client and server using SSL (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall ensure compatibility with Microsoft Windows OS security policies (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for authentication and secure access management.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user credentials and authentication logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce SHA-256 encryption for passwords.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support Windows 10 and later OS versions.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with encryption and access control best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide availability, security monitoring, and OS authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process login authentication within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with 4.38 hours per month downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication security, OS compatibility, and access control validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, OS security policies, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Microsoft Windows security standards, OS authentication protocols, and best encryption practices.
